title: Quark Expeditions marks 25 years with all-new polar adventures
text: Quark Expeditions marks 25 years with all-new polar adventures Quark Expeditions marks 25 years with all-new polar adventures QUARK Expeditions is marking its 25th anniversary with a programme of out of the ordinary expedition cruises. PUBLISHED: 17:43, Fri, Oct 2, 2015 | UPDATED: 17:58, Fri, Oct 2, 2015 PR The 50-year-old ship will crunch through thick ice pack on the way to the North Pole The Explorers’ Collection will showcase the pioneering polar travel company’s access to remote destinations, one-of-a-kind accommodation and exciting modes of travel. Circumnavigating the Falkland Islands, fly-cruising around the most remote coves and inlets of Antarctica and kayaking around the Galapagos Islands to see turtles, sea lions and other marine life are among the expeditions on offer. There are also Arctic expeditions, including short trips such as a three-day fly-in to a temporary Russian scientific station at Barneo Ice Camp in the North Pole, and an Arctic Circumnavigation that includes travelling through the Northwest and Northeast Passages, the Canadian High Arctic and Greenland. And for supreme adventure seekers there is North Pole: The Ultimate Adventure, onboard the icebreaker Victory. PR Travellers can kayak around the Galapagos Islands exploring the unique marine life The 50-year-old ship will crunch through thick ice pack on the way to the North Pole in search of polar bears on the sea ice. The cruise also features helicopter expeditions and a visit to remote Franz Joseph Land, part of an archipelago in the high Russian Arctic. "The Explorers’ Collection caters to travellers who are seeking unique and immersive high adventure experiences," said Andrew White, Quark Expeditions® President. "The trips in the collection will continue to change annually, but will be truly exceptional in expedition travel. “We’re finding passengers are seeking out more adventure in their experiences – they want more unique and intimate ways to explore the world’s most stunning and pristine locales,” White said. PR Quark Expeditions offer a unique way to experience polar adventures PR Passengers are offered the opportunity to stay at the Barneo Ice Camp in the North Pole “Quark is proud to offer these six trips and several unique modes of travel such as storied icebreakers, small exploration ships and extraordinary basecamps which provide really special access and optimal adventure.” Passengers want more unique and intimate ways to explore the world’s most stunning and pristine locales Andrew White, Quark Expeditions President Prices for the bespoke Falkland Islands And Antarctica cruise onboard the 12-passenger exploration ship Hans Hansson starts from £8,700 for the 19-day cruise, with an obligatory transfer package of £1,300 and flights on top. The 10-day Galapagos Islands cruise onboard the expedition ship Evolution costs from £4,000 (two sharing), flights not included. Quark Expeditions specialises in polar adventure cruises on specially-equipped small expedition ships and icebreakers. PR Its expeditions are led by scientists, naturalists and researchers who are experienced expedition leaders, and the onboard programme focuses on educational lectures. For more information go to www.quarkexpeditions.com Related articles
